name: Now, thanks to Tailscale and Nginx Proxy Manager, I have my entire suite of self-hosted apps available on my tailnet, on a custom domain / subdomains, with auto-renewing LetsEncrypt certs. Getting traffic in/out of the proxy container was a challenge, as was HSTS. But it works!

content.html: Now, thanks to Tailscale and Nginx Proxy Manager, I have my entire suite of self-hosted apps available on my tailnet, on a custom domain / subdomains, with auto-renewing LetsEncrypt certs. Getting traffic in/out of the proxy container was a challenge, as was HSTS. But it works!
content.value: Now, thanks to Tailscale and Nginx Proxy Manager, I have my entire suite of self-hosted apps available on my tailnet, on a custom domain / subdomains, with auto-renewing LetsEncrypt certs. Getting traffic in/out of the proxy container was a challenge, as was HSTS. But it works!

summary: @ronguest it is pretty cool! Now I can record YouTube TV content to my NAS, automatically detect commercials for skipping, and play it anywhere via Plex.Not every single channel is available due to licensing restrictions, but only one channel that I actually care about. Not bad :)

content.html:
@ronguest it is pretty cool! Now I can record YouTube TV content to my NAS, automatically detect commercials for skipping, and play it anywhere via Plex.
Not every single channel is available due to licensing restrictions, but only one channel that I actually care about. Not bad :)
content.value: @ronguest it is pretty cool! Now I can record YouTube TV content to my NAS, automatically detect commercials for skipping, and play it anywhere via Plex.Not every single channel is available due to licensing restrictions, but only one channel that I actually care about. Not bad :)

summary: @toddgrotenhuis I‚Äôll see if I can make some time. Quick summary:Install Channels DVR from getchannels.com. It‚Äôs commercial, but there is a free trial for a month.Set it up with your cable or live TV provider using ‚ÄúTV Everywhere.‚Äù Many cable and streaming providers are compatible.Set up github.com/kevdog114... There is a docker container linked on docker hub.Install github.com/xteve-pro... and point it at your m3u and xmltv that you get from the proxyConfigure Plex DVR by pointing it at xTeVe

content.html:
@toddgrotenhuis I‚Äôll see if I can make some time. Quick summary:
Install Channels DVR from getchannels.com. It‚Äôs commercial, but there is a free trial for a month.
Set it up with your cable or live TV provider using ‚ÄúTV Everywhere.‚Äù Many cable and streaming providers are compatible.
Set up github.com/kevdog114... There is a docker container linked on docker hub.
Install github.com/xteve-pro... and point it at your m3u and xmltv that you get from the proxy
Configure Plex DVR by pointing it at xTeVe
content.value: @toddgrotenhuis I‚Äôll see if I can make some time. Quick summary:Install Channels DVR from getchannels.com. It‚Äôs commercial, but there is a free trial for a month.Set it up with your cable or live TV provider using ‚ÄúTV Everywhere.‚Äù Many cable and streaming providers are compatible.Set up github.com/kevdog114... There is a docker container linked on docker hub.Install github.com/xteve-pro... and point it at your m3u and xmltv that you get from the proxyConfigure Plex DVR by pointing it at xTeVe

summary: @cleverdevil very cool. If you post for that first service, what is Plex offering on top of it for you? (I‚Äôm big on Plexamp and the watchlist integration with JustWatch, but weak on the rest of the Plex ecosystem right now)

content.html: @cleverdevil very cool. If you post for that first service, what is Plex offering on top of it for you? (I‚Äôm big on Plexamp and the watchlist integration with JustWatch, but weak on the rest of the Plex ecosystem right now)
content.value: @cleverdevil very cool. If you post for that first service, what is Plex offering on top of it for you? (I‚Äôm big on Plexamp and the watchlist integration with JustWatch, but weak on the rest of the Plex ecosystem right now)

summary: @toddgrotenhuis everything in one place. I have my movie and TV library, audiobooks, family videos, etc. all in Plex.Plus, now when I record something from YouTube TV, it ends up in my Plex library, pre-processed with commercials detected for skipping.

content.html:
@toddgrotenhuis everything in one place. I have my movie and TV library, audiobooks, family videos, etc. all in Plex.
Plus, now when I record something from YouTube TV, it ends up in my Plex library, pre-processed with commercials detected for skipping.
content.value: @toddgrotenhuis everything in one place. I have my movie and TV library, audiobooks, family videos, etc. all in Plex.Plus, now when I record something from YouTube TV, it ends up in my Plex library, pre-processed with commercials detected for skipping.

So, public pool may be a concern if you‚Äôre worried about someone taking it. That said, the transmitter is worthless without the headset, and a replacement is pretty cheap.

summary: @todor indeed, Bluetooth is not an option, hence the solution with a Bluetooth connection from the phone to the transmitter and then FM radio from the transmitter to the headset.

I was leaning toward getting a titanium S7, but they basically no longer exist except in the shady used market.

Now I‚Äôm thinking stainless S8, and I can always trade-up. My S4 won‚Äôt make it another year.

Here I am, in a section of the trail called ‚Äúthe coffin.‚Äù To pass, you have to wedge yourself into a tiny gap between two huge rocks, and shimmy on your back into the darkness. Not for the faint of heart! twitter.com/u/status/15686‚Ä¶
Oh, thanks to @caseyliss for talking up Channels on @atpfm this week. I‚Äôm a convert. Having everything in Plex is amazing!

Six episodes in. If you‚Äôve read the comics, you‚Äôre likely to enjoy it. At times, you‚Äôll adore it.

If you‚Äôve not read the comics, I can imagine that it may feel slow, disjoint, and maybe even boring. But, there is so much there if you look for it.

Read first. Then watch.

The Zygo is a really interest Product case study, as well. They know precisely what problem they‚Äôre solving ‚Äî making new experiences possible through creative compromises.

No, they don‚Äôt sound great. But, they work *underwater*. They‚Äôre comfy. Reliable. Very good battery life.
Circling back to this thread, they just announced a referral program. Let me know if you want to buy a pair of Zygos, and I can get you $30 off. ‚úåÔ∏è
